net.sf.mmm.client.ui.api.dialog

Interface DialogConstants


  • public interface DialogConstants
    This interface is (mis)used to define the constants for common dialog IDs, dialog types, DialogSlots and DialogPlaces.
    Technically mandatory for the core implementation are only TYPE_ROOT and TYPE_MAIN. However, you find the entire common sense here and there are (base) implementations for DialogController that depend on these predefined constants and will make your life a lot easier.
    We recommend that you extend this interface with your own MyProjectDialogConstants to define the constants for your dialogs. In most cases you should avoid defining constants for parameterized DialogPlaces.
    Since:
    1.0.0
    Author:
    Joerg Hohwiller (hohwille at users.sourceforge.net)

    • Field Detail

      • TYPE_ROOT

        static final String TYPE_ROOT
        The type of the root dialog. This is the top-level dialog of the application and represents the UiWidgetMainWindow.
        See Also:
        RootDialogController, Constant Field Values

      • TYPE_PAGE

        static final String TYPE_PAGE
        The type of the page dialog. This is the first custom dialog that defines the structure of the application page (main window). It is supposed to embed itself into the root page and provide slots for child dialogs, at least a main slot. For an example see DialogController.
        See Also:
        AbstractPageDialogController, Constant Field Values

      • TYPE_MAIN

        static final String TYPE_MAIN
        The type of a main dialog. This is a regular dialog displayed in the main content area of the client application window.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • TYPE_HEADER

        static final String TYPE_HEADER
        The type of a header dialog. This is a dialog displayed at the top of the main content area of the client application window above a main dialog.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • TYPE_FOOTER

        static final String TYPE_FOOTER
        The type of a footer dialog. This is a dialog displayed at the bottom of the main content area of the client application window below a main dialog.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • TYPE_NAVIGATION

        static final String TYPE_NAVIGATION
        The type of a navigation dialog. The navigation offers a structured way for the user to navigate through the application. This can happen in form of a menu-bar that is typically placed below the header and above the main dialog. However it is often realized as a list or tree of links that is displayed beside the main dialog (typically on the left).
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • TYPE_SIDE

        static final String TYPE_SIDE
        The type of a side dialog. This is a dialog typically displayed at on the right of the main content area of the client application window beside a main dialog. It typically shows additional information or a summary of the current state (e.g. shopping cart). However, it may also be used to display advertisements.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • DIALOG_ID_ROOT

        static final String DIALOG_ID_ROOT
        The dialog-id of the root dialog.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • DIALOG_ID_PAGE

        static final String DIALOG_ID_PAGE
        The dialog-id of the page dialog.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • DIALOG_ID_NAVIGATION

        static final String DIALOG_ID_NAVIGATION
        The dialog-id of the (default) navigation dialog.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • SLOT_ROOT_PAGE

        static final DialogSlot SLOT_ROOT_PAGE
        The DialogSlot of the root dialog where the page dialog is DialogController.embed(net.sf.mmm.client.ui.base.dialog.DialogController<?>, net.sf.mmm.client.ui.base.dialog.DialogSlot) embedded.

      • SLOT_PAGE_MAIN

        static final DialogSlot SLOT_PAGE_MAIN
        The DialogSlot for the main dialog.

      • SLOT_PAGE_NAVIGATION

        static final DialogSlot SLOT_PAGE_NAVIGATION
        The DialogSlot for the navigation dialog.

      • DIALOG_ID_HOME

        static final String DIALOG_ID_HOME
        The dialog-id of the main dialog that defines the home screen or start page. It is just a recommendation to make your life easier. You can also define your own ID and place and just ignore these constant if you have a reason to do so.
        See Also:
        DialogManager.initialize(DialogPlace), Constant Field Values

      • PLACE_HOME

        static final DialogPlace PLACE_HOME
        The DialogPlace for the home dialog.
        See Also:
        DialogManager.initialize(DialogPlace)
